messages.message: Our customer Kerring wants workspace members to be able to manually run a deployment. Right now the run button is disabled in the UI. @Jessica  can you confirm if this is the intended behavior or if this is a bug? I can replicate this on prod right now as the run button has disappeared yet the documentation confirms they have should have the permission to do so.

They can't run the deployment if they don't have access to the underlying app, could that be the case? I think we should make it more obvious in the UI when that is the case and add that to the documentation too
oooo I didn't realize that - we should rethink this cc: @jack.robbins
I think the easier way to address this is that we should always allow a user to run a deployment (regardless of the underlying app permission).
By creating a deployment with an app you are giving permission to the whole workspace to run it
I'll unblock them for now, but @jack.robbins let's take a look at this
